issue.title: [C++] arrow-utility-test causes failures on a big-endian platform
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-8486](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
The current master causes the following failures in arrow-util-test.

```Java

Start 17: arrow-utility-test
 ...
 17: [ PASSED ] 253 tests.
 17: [ FAILED ] 11 tests, listed below:
 17: [ FAILED ] Bitmap.ShiftingWordsOptimization
 17: [ FAILED ] Bitmap.VisitWordsAnd
 17: [ FAILED ] BitArray.TestBool
 17: [ FAILED ] BitArray.TestValues
 17: [ FAILED ] Rle.SpecificSequences
 17: [ FAILED ] Rle.TestValues
 17: [ FAILED ] BitRle.Flush
 17: [ FAILED ] BitRle.Random
 17: [ FAILED ] BitRle.RepeatedPattern
 17: [ FAILED ] BitRle.Overflow
 17: [ FAILED ] RleDecoder.GetBatchSpaced
```

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17086720) by Kazuaki Ishizaki (kiszk):*
`[~apitrou]` Could you give me your advice?
I am working for addressing an issue described in  ARROW-4018. The below your suggested code works well for primitive types.   

On the other hand, I enable `-DARROW_PARQUET=ON` in cmake, non-primitive types (parquet::FixedLenByteArray, parquet::ByteArray, and parquet::Int96) are passed as T. In this case, this line `current_value_ = static_cast<uint64_t>(value)` causes the cast error.   
IMHO, these cases use 32 as bit_width_ (just my guess, I did not confirm it). Am I correct?

While I tried to create a patch by using std::enable_if or constexpr, I was not successful to create it. Are there any advices to handle these three cases?


```Java

    T value = T();
    bool result =
        bit_reader_.GetAligned<T>(static_cast<int>(BitUtil::CeilDiv(bit_width_, 8)), &value);
    current_value_ = static_cast<uint64_t>(value);
```

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17087543) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I don't think parquet::FixedLenByteArray and parquet::ByteArray ever get passed to RleDecoder. I'm not sure about Int96.

In addition to fixing NextCounts(), I think you also need to fix the raw memcpys in GetAligned() and PutAligned() in arrow/utils/bit_stream_utils.h.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17087545) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
If that can help you move forward, I would suggest ignoring Int96 for now. As I said elsewhere, it's deprecated.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17087587) by Kazuaki Ishizaki (kiszk):*
> I don't think parquet::FixedLenByteArray and parquet::ByteArray ever get passed to RleDecoder. I'm not sure about Int96.

In my understanding, unfortunately, it occurs at https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/parquet/encoding.cc#L2530-L2559. They read to call the constructor of `RleDecoder` at https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/parquet/encoding.cc#L1484. Then, `T` is passed to `NextCounts()` thru `GetBatchWithDictSpaced()` at https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/cpp/src/parquet/encoding.cc#L1502

While Int96 is depreciated, test cases are there. Of course, I can make it low-priority.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17087597) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I think that is a mistake in GetBatchWithDict() and GetBatchWithDictSpaced(). You should be able to apply the following patch:
https://gist.github.com/pitrou/883fa5a4c7c583ae876d72f1b6605def

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17087638) by Kazuaki Ishizaki (kiszk):*
Great, thank you very much. I will apply it.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17087671) by Kazuaki Ishizaki (kiszk):*
I confirmed that this change works well. Thanks again. I struggled with this for many weeks.
I would appreciate it if you could create a PR for this patch.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17087676) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
I'll do it.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-8486?focusedCommentId=17087868) by Kazuaki Ishizaki (kiszk):*
Thank you very much for submitting https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6991.
